[1]Tony Bennett, Toni Morrison and Zoe                        * Caldwell. It was marvelous. First                          * time I've attended the Kennedy Honors. Jane Alexander is a client. Old                            * friend of Zoe's. What an actress.                          * Anyway... 
[2]... Connie, could you bring in your copy of the Cox financials? 
[3]Tony sang "The Best Is Yet To Come."                        * Mr. Bennett. 
[4]Yeah, okay. 
[5]So. We've drawn up the papers and are prepared to execute service on Osbourne if you so elect, Mrs. Cox. Our missiles are pointed at his capital, so to speak, and we await only your word. But, be mindful, madam: once these missiles are launched, there is no recalling them. We are not picking daisies. We are declaring war, and hostilities will then impose their own logic. I think you understand what I'm saying. 
[6]Mm-hm. 
[7]Of course. But since we are at the point of no return, I always urge my clients at this juncture to give it one more day of reflection.
dialogues.NEW EMBASSY MAN:
[1]Can you tell me where this material comes from? 
[2]Excuse me? 
[3]There is more material? 
[4]You are not ideological. 
[5]Hm? 
[6]... We will examine the material.   How do I contact? 
[7]So... I call Hardbodies, I ask for... Chad?
dialogues.DEL:
[1]Can    we just----I'm sorry to interrupt but    we have to let the folks at home see    this illustration! Can we just get    a shot of that... 
[2]There----there it is. Oliver. Interrupting the filibuster with---- 
[3]Wonderful! The book is "Point of Order, Oliver!" and the talented author is Sandra Pfarrer. We're gonna go to a station break and then be right back with Bud Fraighling, the Sultan of Salad, and Part Two of our special interview with Dermot Mulroney. So keep it where it is! 
[4]...Great segment. 
[5]Yeah, you know we thought it might be fun if you joined us with Bud Fraighling and help make the Fiesta Salad, when we move over. 
[6]Oh, sure! No! Only if you want to! Your segment went great, we just thought---- 
[7]Okay, great!
dialogues.VOICE:
[1]Is this a, uh, goat cheese? 
[2]Linda, there's a Mr. Krapotkin on line                   * two. 
[3]Linda? 
[4]This is Ilan Krapotkin. Russian embassy. Returning your call. 
[5]Harry, it's Osbourne Cox. 
[6]... Harry?
dialogues.TERIKHIAN:
[1]... I know this kind of man.    We've seen this. 
[2]... Mrs. Cox, you can't let this man take advantage of you. And he will. He will. 
[3]Look, sure, I----I'm obliged to tell you you should try to salvage things. And you should. People turn themselves around. Not unheard-of. But. You---- you haven't broached the possibility of divorce yet? 
[4]Well that's good.   Because first you should get all his financials. Before he's forewarned. Because here's a man, here's a man, practiced in deceit, this is almost, you could say it's his job, practiced at hiding things, and there is no reason, it is not improper, there is no reason for you not to get a picture of the household finances. Paper files, computer files, whatever----this is your prerogative. You can be a spy too, madam. Do this before you put him on alert. Before the turtle can draw in his head and his, uh... 
[5]... Feet. 
[6]... And hopefully everything will work out. He will reform. But! If not: forewarned is forearmed.
dialogues.PATIENT:
[1]Uh-huh.    And what about the thigh area? 
[2]Uh-huh. I know, I can work out on my arms til the cows come home, but... 
[3]The Litzkes are big. 
[4]My mom had an ass that could pull a bus. 
[5]Father's side too, although Dad tends to carry his weight in front of him. 
[6]In the gut area. Derriere, not so much.
